intro: Eriosema intermedium, commonly known as the velvetleaf sarsaparilla, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant has hairy, glandular leaves that give it a velvety appearance, and its flowers are typically pale yellow to greenish in color. Eriosema intermedium is often found in grasslands and along riverbanks, thriving in well-drained soils. It is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique foliage and flowering habit.
